intro: Rubus macranthus, commonly known as the large-flowered blackberry, is a species of bramble native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces large, showy white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruits are aggregate berries that ripen to a deep red or black color in the summer. Rubus macranthus is often found in woodland edges and moist, well-drained soils.
